verses.verse: (A Song of Ascents.) To Thee I lift <S%H5375><s%> up my eyes, <S%H5869><s%> O Thou who art enthroned <S%H3427><s%> in the heavens! <S%H8064><s%>

Behold, <S%H2009><s%> as the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of servants <S%H5650><s%> [look] to the hand <S%H3027><s%> of their master, <S%H113><s%> As the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of a maid <S%H8189><s%> to the hand <S%H3027><s%> of her mistress; <S%H1404><s%> So <S%H3651><s%> our eyes <S%H5869><s%> [look] to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> our God, <S%H430><s%> Until <S%H5704><s%> He shall be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to us.
Be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to us, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to us; For we are greatly <S%H7227><s%> filled <S%H7646><s%> with contempt. <S%H937><s%>

Our soul <S%H5315><s%> is greatly <S%H7227><s%> filled <S%H7646><s%> With the scoffing <S%H3933><s%> of those who <S%H7600><s%> are at ease, <S%H7600><s%> [And] with the contempt <S%H937><s%> of the proud. <S%H1349><s%>
